resources.string: Tip: Long press on any subheading in the app (bold text) to know more about that section.

* The three buttons correspond to three different subjects, each with their own questions.\n * After opening a subject, Read mode and Practice mode can be switched using top-right menu button.\n * The language of the questions can be changed in Settings accessible using top-right menu button.
* A test with 20 randomly selected questions from the 3 subjects.

* Read mode and Practice mode can be switched using top-right menu button.
 * In Read mode, correct answers are marked.
 * In Practice mode, users can attempt before seeing the correct answer.
 * The language of the questions can be changed in Settings accessible using top-right menu button.
 * Go to Settings page (accessible via top-right menu button) for more Settings.
Info dialog not shown during test
* The language for questions and their choices.\n * This setting is not applicable to remaining GUI components like buttons etc.

* This is used to set how to navigate from one question to another.
 * Using buttons Previous and Next: shows two buttons one each at the two bottom corners.
 * Using swipe: Swipe on the screen to navigate between questions.
 * One of them must be checked, and the app forces at least one to be checked.

* This is used to set when to validate the user choice in practice mode.\n * Use Check Button: provides a button at the bottom which needs to be clicked after selecting a choice to show if it is correct or not.\n * Auto validate on choice selection: as soon as the user selects a choice, it is shown to be correct or not.
